nodes.bodyText: Maybe this should be 1000 or at least a different number from min.
Sorry for the mistake. I will correct it.

Add more specific comments like
"# minimum number of committed logs in memory, after each log deletion, at most such number of logs will remain in memory. Increasing the number will reduce the chance to use snapshot in catch-ups, but will also increase memory footprint"
"# maximum number of committed logs in memory, when reached, a log deletion will be triggered. Increasing the number will reduce the chance to use snapshot in catch-ups, but will also increase memory footprint"

 use_batch_in_catch_up=true
 
-# max number of committed logs to be saved
-max_number_of_logs=100
+# minimum number of committed logs in memory
+min_num_of_logs_in_mem=100
+
+# maximum number of committed logs in memory
+max_num_of_logs_in_mem=1000

I see. Thanks for your suggestion.
This exception is unneeded, and we should solve it silently by triggering a log deletion.
